name: Ugadi Celebration
description: Celebrate the Telugu New Year with traditional rituals, festive meals, and cultural programs in Vijayawada.

about.title: Ugadi Celebration
about.text: Ugadi, the Telugu New Year, is a vibrant festival marking renewal and prosperity. Families prepare 'Ugadi Pachadi,' a dish symbolizing life's mixed flavors, and decorate homes with mango leaves and rangoli. Cultural programs, including classical dance and music, fill Vijayawada with festive spirit.

highlights.name: Panchanga Sravanam
highlights.desc: Listening to the annual astrological predictions by priests.

highlights.name: Ugadi Pachadi
highlights.desc: A unique dish made with six flavors, representing life's emotions.

highlights.name: Cultural Performances
highlights.desc: Traditional dance and music shows in public squares.

highlights.name: Rangoli Competitions
highlights.desc: Colorful patterns created by locals to adorn homes and streets.

name: Tirupati Brahmotsavam
description: A grand religious festival at the Tirumala temple, featuring processions, rituals, and thousands of devotees.

about.title: Tirupati Brahmotsavam
about.text: Brahmotsavam is a nine-day festival at the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple, celebrating Lord Vishnu. Devotees witness grand chariot processions, floral decorations, and Vedic rituals. The event attracts millions, with Tirupati glowing in spiritual fervor.

highlights.name: Garuda Seva
highlights.desc: A grand procession with the deity on a Garuda vahana.

highlights.name: Rathotsavam
highlights.desc: The chariot festival where devotees pull the temple chariot.

highlights.name: Vedic Rituals
highlights.desc: Daily homams and offerings performed by priests.

highlights.name: Temple Decorations
highlights.desc: Floral and light decorations enhancing the temple's grandeur.

name: Vizag Beach Festival
description: A vibrant celebration by the beach with food stalls, folk performances, music concerts, and sand art displays.

about.title: Vizag Beach Festival
about.text: Held along the scenic Visakhapatnam coastline, this festival blends music, food, and art. Enjoy live concerts, taste coastal delicacies, and watch sand sculptures come to life under the stars.

highlights.name: Live Music
highlights.desc: Concerts featuring local and national artists.

highlights.name: Sand Art
highlights.desc: Intricate sculptures created by skilled artists on the beach.

highlights.name: Food Stalls
highlights.desc: Savor seafood and regional dishes from local vendors.

highlights.name: Folk Dances
highlights.desc: Traditional performances showcasing Andhra's culture.

name: Lepakshi Festival
description: A cultural heritage event highlighting Andhra's classical dance, crafts, and the architectural marvel of Lepakshi temple.

about.title: Lepakshi Festival
about.text: Celebrating the historic Lepakshi temple, this festival showcases classical dance, handicrafts, and temple tours. Visitors explore the iconic Veerabhadra temple and its intricate carvings.

highlights.name: Bharatanatyam Performances
highlights.desc: Classical dance shows by renowned artists.

highlights.name: Craft Stalls
highlights.desc: Handmade textiles and pottery from local artisans.

highlights.name: Temple Tours
highlights.desc: Guided tours of Lepakshi's architectural wonders.

highlights.name: Art Exhibitions
highlights.desc: Showcases of traditional Andhra paintings.

name: Rayalaseema Food Festival
description: Taste the fiery and flavorful dishes of Rayalaseema with cooking demos, stalls, and folk entertainment.

about.title: Rayalaseema Food Festival
about.text: This culinary festival in Kurnool celebrates Rayalaseema's spicy cuisine. From gongura pachadi to kandi podi, enjoy authentic dishes, cooking demos, and folk performances.

highlights.name: Cooking Demos
highlights.desc: Live demonstrations of traditional Rayalaseema recipes.

highlights.name: Food Stalls
highlights.desc: Taste spicy curries, biryanis, and sweets.

highlights.name: Folk Music
highlights.desc: Performances of regional songs and dances.

highlights.name: Spice Market
highlights.desc: Buy local spices and condiments used in Rayalaseema cuisine.

name: Makara Sankranti
description: A harvest festival marking the arrival of spring, celebrated with kite flying, rangoli, and traditional rituals across Andhra Pradesh.

about.title: Makara Sankranti
about.text: Makara Sankranti heralds spring with vibrant celebrations. Homes are adorned with muggu (rangoli) and Gobbemma, while skies fill with colorful kites. Families share sweets like chakkara pongal and engage in joyful kite duels, symbolizing hope and renewal.

highlights.name: Bhogi Day
highlights.desc: Families celebrate with bonfires and communal feasts.

highlights.name: Pongal Day
highlights.desc: A harvest festival with offerings of freshly harvested rice.

highlights.name: Rooster Fighting
highlights.desc: Traditional sport in rural areas, showcasing trained roosters.

highlights.name: Rangoli
highlights.desc: Colorful patterns created with powders and petals.

highlights.name: Cards Playing
highlights.desc: Family gatherings for card games during festivities.
